class Doctrine\DBAL\Types::TypeRegistry

The type registry is responsible for holding a map of all known DBAL types.
The types are stored using the flyweight pattern so that one type only exists as exactly one instance.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\TypeRegistry::__construct ($instances = []) : void

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\TypeRegistry::get ($name) : Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type

Finds a type by the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\TypeRegistry::lookupName ($type) : string

Finds a name for the given type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\TypeRegistry::has ($name) : bool

Checks if there is a type of the given name.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\TypeRegistry::register ($name, $type) : void

Registers a custom type to the type map.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\TypeRegistry::override ($name, $type) : void

Overrides an already defined type to use a different implementation.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\TypeRegistry::getMap () : array

Gets the map of all registered types and their corresponding type instances.

class Doctrine\DBAL\Types::ConversionException

Conversion Exception is thrown when the database to PHP conversion fails.

property string Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::message

property integer Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::code

property NULL Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::file

property NULL Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::line

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::conversionFailed ($value, $toType, $previous = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException

Thrown when a Database to Doctrine Type Conversion fails.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::conversionFailedFormat ($value, $toType, $expectedFormat, $previous = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException

Thrown when a Database to Doctrine Type Conversion fails and we can make a statement
about the expected format.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::conversionFailedInvalidType ($value, $toType, $possibleTypes, $previous = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException

Thrown when the PHP value passed to the converter was not of the expected type.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::conversionFailedSerialization ($value, $format, $error) : Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::conversionFailedUnserialization ($format, $error) : Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::notSupported ($method) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::invalidPlatformType ($invalidPlatform) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::invalidPlatformVersionSpecified ($version, $expectedFormat) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

Returns a new instance for an invalid specified platform version.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::driverRequired ($url = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::unknownDriver ($unknownDriverName, $knownDrivers) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::invalidWrapperClass ($wrapperClass) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::invalidDriverClass ($driverClass) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::noColumnsSpecifiedForTable ($tableName) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::typeExists ($name) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::unknownColumnType ($name) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::typeNotFound ($name) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::typeNotRegistered ($type) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::typeAlreadyRegistered ($type) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::__construct ($message = "", $code = 0, $previous = null) : void

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::__wakeup () : void

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::getMessage () : string

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::getCode () : void

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::getFile () : string

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::getLine () : int

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::getTrace () : array

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::getPrevious () : ?\Throwable

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::getTraceAsString () : string

method Doctrine\DBAL\Types\ConversionException::__toString () : string

interface Doctrine\DBAL\Types::PhpIntegerMappingType

Implementations should map a database type to a PHP integer.

class Doctrine\DBAL::Configuration

Configuration container for the Doctrine DBAL.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\SQLLoggernull Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::sqlLogger

The SQL logger in use. If null, SQL logging is disabled.

property Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cachenull Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::resultCacheImpl

The cache driver implementation that is used for query result caching.

property callablenull Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::schemaAssetsFilter

The callable to use to filter schema assets.

property bool Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::autoCommit

The default auto-commit mode for connections.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::__construct () : void

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setSQLLogger ($logger = null) : void

Sets the SQL logger to use. Defaults to NULL which means SQL logging is disabled.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getSQLLogger () : ?Doctrine\DBAL\Logging\SQLLogger

Gets the SQL logger that is used.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getResultCache () : ?Psr\Cache\CacheItemPoolInterface

Gets the cache driver implementation that is used for query result caching.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getResultCacheImpl () : ?Doctrine\Common\Cache\Cache

Gets the cache driver implementation that is used for query result caching.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setResultCache ($cache) : void

Sets the cache driver implementation that is used for query result caching.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setResultCacheImpl ($cacheImpl) : void

Sets the cache driver implementation that is used for query result caching.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setSchemaAssetsFilter ($callable = null) : void

Sets the callable to use to filter schema assets.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getSchemaAssetsFilter () : ?callable

Returns the callable to use to filter schema assets.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setAutoCommit ($autoCommit) : void

Sets the default auto-commit mode for connections.

If a connection is in auto-commit mode, then all its SQL statements will be executed and committed as individual
transactions. Otherwise, its SQL statements are grouped into transactions that are terminated by a call to either
the method commit or the method rollback. By default, new connections are in auto-commit mode.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getAutoCommit () : bool

Returns the default auto-commit mode for connections.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setMiddlewares ($middlewares) : Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getMiddlewares () : arrayDoctrine\DBAL\Driver\Middleware[]

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::getSchemaManagerFactory () : ?Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\SchemaManagerFactory

method Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration::setSchemaManagerFactory ($schemaManagerFactory) : Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration

class Doctrine\DBAL::Exception

property string Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::message

property integer Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::code

property NULL Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::file

property NULL Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::line

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::notSupported ($method) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::invalidPlatformType ($invalidPlatform) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::invalidPlatformVersionSpecified ($version, $expectedFormat) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

Returns a new instance for an invalid specified platform version.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::driverRequired ($url = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::unknownDriver ($unknownDriverName, $knownDrivers) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::invalidWrapperClass ($wrapperClass) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::invalidDriverClass ($driverClass) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::noColumnsSpecifiedForTable ($tableName) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::typeExists ($name) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::unknownColumnType ($name) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::typeNotFound ($name) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::typeNotRegistered ($type) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::typeAlreadyRegistered ($type) : Doctrine\DBAL\Exception

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::__construct ($message = "", $code = 0, $previous = null) : void

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::__wakeup () : void

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::getMessage () : string

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::getCode () : void

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::getFile () : string

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::getLine () : int

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::getTrace () : array

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::getPrevious () : ?\Throwable

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::getTraceAsString () : string

method Doctrine\DBAL\Exception::__toString () : string

class Doctrine\DBAL::Connection

A database abstraction-level connection that implements features like events, transaction isolation levels,
configuration, emulated transaction nesting, lazy connecting and more.

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::PARAM_INT_ARRAY

Represents an array of ints to be expanded by Doctrine SQL parsing.

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::PARAM_STR_ARRAY

Represents an array of strings to be expanded by Doctrine SQL parsing.

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::PARAM_ASCII_STR_ARRAY

Represents an array of ascii strings to be expanded by Doctrine SQL parsing.

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::ARRAY_PARAM_OFFSET

Offset by which PARAM_* constants are detected as arrays of the param type.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connectionnull Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::_conn

The wrapped driver connection.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::_config

property Doctrine\Common\EventManager Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::_eventManager

property Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::_expr

property Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManagernull Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::_schemaManager

The schema manager.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::_driver

The used DBAL driver.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::__construct ($params, $driver, $config = null, $eventManager = null) : void

Initializes a new instance of the Connection class.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getParams () : array

Gets the parameters used during instantiation.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getDatabase () : stringnull

Gets the name of the currently selected database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getDriver () : Doctrine\DBAL\Driver

Gets the DBAL driver instance.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getConfiguration () : Doctrine\DBAL\Configuration

Gets the Configuration used by the Connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getEventManager () : Doctrine\Common\EventManager

Gets the EventManager used by the Connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getDatabasePlatform () : Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\AbstractPlatform

Gets the DatabasePlatform for the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::createExpressionBuilder () : Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder

Creates an expression builder for the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getExpressionBuilder () : Doctrine\DBAL\Query\Expression\ExpressionBuilder

Gets the ExpressionBuilder for the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::connect () : bool

Establishes the connection with the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::isAutoCommit () : bool

Returns the current auto-commit mode for this connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setAutoCommit ($autoCommit) : void

Sets auto-commit mode for this connection.

If a connection is in auto-commit mode, then all its SQL statements will be executed and committed as individual
transactions. Otherwise, its SQL statements are grouped into transactions that are terminated by a call to either
the method commit or the method rollback. By default, new connections are in auto-commit mode.

NOTE: If this method is called during a transaction and the auto-commit mode is changed, the transaction is
committed. If this method is called and the auto-commit mode is not changed, the call is a no-op.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchAssociative ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : array

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the first row of the result
as an associative array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchNumeric ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : listfalse

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the first row of the result
as a numerically indexed array.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchOne ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : mixedfalse

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the value of a single column
of the first row of the result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::isConnected () : bool

Whether an actual connection to the database is established.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::isTransactionActive () : bool

Checks whether a transaction is currently active.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::delete ($table, $criteria, $types = []) : intstring

Executes an SQL DELETE statement on a table.

Table expression and columns are not escaped and are not safe for user-input.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::close () : void

Closes the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setTransactionIsolation ($level) : intstring

Sets the transaction isolation level.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getTransactionIsolation () : Doctrine\DBAL\TransactionIsolationLevel::*()

Gets the currently active transaction isolation level.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::update ($table, $data, $criteria, $types = []) : intstring

Executes an SQL UPDATE statement on a table.

Table expression and columns are not escaped and are not safe for user-input.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::insert ($table, $data, $types = []) : intstring

Inserts a table row with specified data.

Table expression and columns are not escaped and are not safe for user-input.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::quoteIdentifier ($str) : string

Quotes a string so it can be safely used as a table or column name, even if
it is a reserved name.

Delimiting style depends on the underlying database platform that is being used.

NOTE: Just because you CAN use quoted identifiers does not mean
you SHOULD use them. In general, they end up causing way more
problems than they solve.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::quote ($value, $type = Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::STRING) : mixed

The usage of this method is discouraged. Use prepared statements
or Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\AbstractPlatform::quoteStringLiteral() instead.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchAllNumeric ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : arraylist

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an array of numeric arrays.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchAllAssociative ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : arraylist

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an array of associative arrays.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchAllKeyValue ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : array

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an associative array with the keys
mapped to the first column and the values mapped to the second column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchAllAssociativeIndexed ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : array

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an associative array with the keys mapped
to the first column and the values being an associative array representing the rest of the columns
and their values.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::fetchFirstColumn ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : arraylist

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an array of the first column values.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::iterateNumeric ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : \Traversable

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an iterator over rows represented as numeric arrays.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::iterateAssociative ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : \Traversable

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an iterator over rows represented
as associative arrays.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::iterateKeyValue ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : \Traversable

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an iterator with the keys
mapped to the first column and the values mapped to the second column.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::iterateAssociativeIndexed ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : \Traversable

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an iterator with the keys mapped
to the first column and the values being an associative array representing the rest of the columns
and their values.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::iterateColumn ($query, $params = [], $types = []) : \Traversable

Prepares and executes an SQL query and returns the result as an iterator over the first column values.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::prepare ($sql) : Doctrine\DBAL\Statement

Prepares an SQL statement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::executeQuery ($sql, $params = [], $types = [], $qcp = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Result

Executes an, optionally parametrized, SQL query.

If the query is parametrized, a prepared statement is used.
If an SQLLogger is configured, the execution is logged.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::executeCacheQuery ($sql, $params, $types, $qcp) : Doctrine\DBAL\Result

Executes a caching query.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::executeStatement ($sql, $params = [], $types = []) : intstring

Executes an SQL statement with the given parameters and returns the number of affected rows.

Could be used for:

  • DML statements: INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, etc.
  • DDL statements: CREATE, DROP, ALTER, etc.
  • DCL statements: GRANT, REVOKE, etc.
  • Session control statements: ALTER SESSION, SET, DECLARE, etc.
  • Other statements that don't yield a row set.

This method supports PDO binding types as well as DBAL mapping types.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getTransactionNestingLevel () : int

Returns the current transaction nesting level.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::lastInsertId ($name = null) : stringintfalse

Returns the ID of the last inserted row, or the last value from a sequence object,
depending on the underlying driver.

Note: This method may not return a meaningful or consistent result across different drivers,
because the underlying database may not even support the notion of AUTO_INCREMENT/IDENTITY
columns or sequences.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::transactional ($func) : T

Executes a function in a transaction.

The function gets passed this Connection instance as an (optional) parameter.

If an exception occurs during execution of the function or transaction commit,
the transaction is rolled back and the exception re-thrown.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setNestTransactionsWithSavepoints ($nestTransactionsWithSavepoints) : void

Sets if nested transactions should use savepoints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::getNestTransactionsWithSavepoints () : bool

Gets if nested transactions should use savepoints.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::_getNestedTransactionSavePointName () : string

Returns the savepoint name to use for nested transactions.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::beginTransaction () : bool

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::commit () : bool

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::rollBack () : bool

Cancels any database changes done during the current transaction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::createSavepoint ($savepoint) : void

Creates a new savepoint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::releaseSavepoint ($savepoint) : void

Releases the given savepoint.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::rollbackSavepoint ($savepoint) : void

Rolls back to the given savepoint.

database schema through the connection.

Gets the SchemaManager that can be used to inspect or change the
database schema through the connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::setRollbackOnly () : void

Marks the current transaction so that the only possible
outcome for the transaction to be rolled back.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Connection::isRollbackOnly () : bool

Checks whether the current transaction is marked for rollback only.

class Doctrine\DBAL::ParameterType

Contains statement parameter types.

Represents the SQL NULL data type.

Represents the SQL INTEGER data type.

Represents the SQL CHAR, VARCHAR, or other string data type.

Represents the SQL large object data type.

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::BOOLEAN

Represents a boolean data type.

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::BINARY

Represents a binary string data type.

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::ASCII

Represents an ASCII string data type

class Doctrine\DBAL::Statement

A database abstraction-level statement that implements support for logging, DBAL mapping types, etc.

property string Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::sql

The SQL statement.

property mixed[] Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::params

The bound parameters.

property int[]string[] Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::types

The parameter types.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::stmt

The underlying driver statement.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\AbstractPlatform Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::platform

The underlying database platform.

property Doctrine\DBAL\Connection Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::conn

The connection this statement is bound to and executed on.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::__construct ($conn, $statement, $sql) : void

Creates a new Statement for the given SQL and Connection.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::bindValue ($param, $value, $type = Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::STRING) : bool

Binds a parameter value to the statement.

The value can optionally be bound with a DBAL mapping type.
If bound with a DBAL mapping type, the binding type is derived from the mapping
type and the value undergoes the conversion routines of the mapping type before
being bound.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::bindParam ($param, &$variable, $type = Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::STRING, $length = null) : bool

Binds a parameter to a value by reference.

Binding a parameter by reference does not support DBAL mapping types.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::execute ($params = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Result

Executes the statement with the currently bound parameters.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::executeQuery ($params = []) : Doctrine\DBAL\Result

Executes the statement with the currently bound parameters and return result.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::executeStatement ($params = []) : int

Executes the statement with the currently bound parameters and return affected rows.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Statement::getWrappedStatement () : Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement

Gets the wrapped driver statement.

class Doctrine\DBAL::DriverManager

Factory for creating Doctrine\DBAL\Connection instances.

method Doctrine\DBAL\DriverManager::getConnection ($params, $config = null, $eventManager = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Connection

Creates a connection object based on the specified parameters.
This method returns a Doctrine\DBAL\Connection which wraps the underlying
driver connection.

$params must contain at least one of the following.

Either 'driver' with one of the array keys of Doctrine\DBAL\DriverManager::DRIVER_MAP,
OR 'driverClass' that contains the full class name (with namespace) of the
driver class to instantiate.

Other (optional) parameters:

user (string):
The username to use when connecting.

password (string):
The password to use when connecting.

driverOptions (array):
Any additional driver-specific options for the driver. These are just passed
through to the driver.

wrapperClass:
You may specify a custom wrapper class through the 'wrapperClass'
parameter but this class MUST inherit from Doctrine\DBAL\Connection.

driverClass:
The driver class to use.

method Doctrine\DBAL\DriverManager::getAvailableDrivers () : arraystring[]

Returns the list of supported drivers.

class Doctrine\DBAL::ArrayParameterType

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\ArrayParameterType::INTEGER

Represents an array of ints to be expanded by Doctrine SQL parsing.

Represents an array of strings to be expanded by Doctrine SQL parsing.

classconstant integer Doctrine\DBAL\ArrayParameterType::ASCII

Represents an array of ascii strings to be expanded by Doctrine SQL parsing.

interface Doctrine\DBAL::Driver

Driver interface.
Interface that all DBAL drivers must implement.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::connect ($params) : Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection

Attempts to create a connection with the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::getDatabasePlatform () : Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\AbstractPlatform

Gets the DatabasePlatform instance that provides all the metadata about
the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::getSchemaManager ($conn, $platform) : Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager

Gets the SchemaManager that can be used to inspect and change the underlying
database schema of the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\Driver::getExceptionConverter () : Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\API\ExceptionConverter

Gets the ExceptionConverter that can be used to convert driver-level exceptions into DBAL exceptions.

interface Doctrine\DBAL::VersionAwarePlatformDriver

Contract for a driver that is able to create platform instances by version.

Doctrine uses different platform classes for different vendor versions to
support the correct features and SQL syntax of each version.
This interface should be implemented by drivers that are capable to do this
distinction.

method Doctrine\DBAL\VersionAwarePlatformDriver::createDatabasePlatformForVersion ($version) : Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\AbstractPlatform

Factory method for creating the appropriate platform instance for the given version.

method Doctrine\DBAL\VersionAwarePlatformDriver::connect ($params) : Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Connection

Attempts to create a connection with the database.

method Doctrine\DBAL\VersionAwarePlatformDriver::getDatabasePlatform () : Doctrine\DBAL\Platforms\AbstractPlatform

Gets the DatabasePlatform instance that provides all the metadata about
the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\VersionAwarePlatformDriver::getSchemaManager ($conn, $platform) : Doctrine\DBAL\Schema\AbstractSchemaManager

Gets the SchemaManager that can be used to inspect and change the underlying
database schema of the platform this driver connects to.

method Doctrine\DBAL\VersionAwarePlatformDriver::getExceptionConverter () : Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\API\ExceptionConverter

Gets the ExceptionConverter that can be used to convert driver-level exceptions into DBAL exceptions.

namespace Doctrine\Deprecations

class Doctrine\Deprecations::Deprecation

Manages Deprecation logging in different ways.

By default triggered exceptions are not logged.

To enable different deprecation logging mechanisms you can call the
following methods:

  • Minimal collection of deprecations via getTriggeredDeprecations()
    \Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::enableTrackingDeprecations();

  • Uses @trigger_error with E_USER_DEPRECATED
    \Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::enableWithTriggerError();

  • Sends deprecation messages via a PSR-3 logger
    \Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::enableWithPsrLogger($logger);

Packages that trigger deprecations should use the trigger() or
triggerIfCalledFromOutside() methods.

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::trigger ($package, $link, $message, ...$args) : void

Trigger a deprecation for the given package and identfier.

The link should point to a Github issue or Wiki entry detailing the
deprecation. It is additionally used to de-duplicate the trigger of the
same deprecation during a request.

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::triggerIfCalledFromOutside ($package, $link, $message, ...$args) : void

Trigger a deprecation for the given package and identifier when called from outside.

"Outside" means we assume that $package is currently installed as a
dependency and the caller is not a file in that package. When $package
is installed as a root package then deprecations triggered from the
tests folder are also considered "outside".

This deprecation method assumes that you are using Composer to install
the dependency and are using the default /vendor/ folder and not a
Composer plugin to change the install location. The assumption is also
that $package is the exact composer packge name.

Compared to Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::trigger() this method causes some overhead when
deprecation tracking is enabled even during deduplication, because it
needs to call Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::debug_backtrace()

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::enableTrackingDeprecations () : void

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::enableWithTriggerError () : void

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::enableWithPsrLogger ($logger) : void

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::withoutDeduplication () : void

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::disable () : void

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::ignorePackage ($packageName) : void

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::ignoreDeprecations (...$links) : void

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::getUniqueTriggeredDeprecationsCount () : int

method Doctrine\Deprecations\Deprecation::getTriggeredDeprecations () : array

Returns each triggered deprecation link identifier and the amount of occurrences.

namespace ryunosuke

namespace ryunosuke\dbml


ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder ryunosuke\dbml\Database::fetchArray()


ryunosuke\dbml\Database::__construct()
FilesystemCache ApcuCache

$tableDescriptor ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\TableDescriptor

  • base: '(joinsign)tablename(pkval)@scope:fkeyname[condition]<groupby>+order-by#offset-limit AS Alias.col1, col2 AS C2'
joinsignJOIN '*':CROSS, '+':INNER, '<':LEFT, '>':RIGHT, '~':AUTO, ',':FROM
tablename
(pkval)
@scope Gateway scope
:fkeynameJOIN
[condition]JOIN yaml where
{condition}JOIN yaml
<groupby>GROUP BY
+order-byORDER BY
#offset-limitLIMIT, OFFSET
AS Alias
.col1, col2 AS C2

base JOIN

  • auto join: 'base~base'
  • inner join: 'base+base'
  • left join: 'base<base'
  • subselect: 'base/base'


SQL SELECT FROM JOIN WHERE GROUP ORDER LIMIT

base

# tablename 
$db->select('t_article');
// SELECT * FROM t_article

# @scope t_article  active where: delete_flg=0
$db->select('t_article@active');
// SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE t_article.delete_flg = 0

# @scope t_article  latest order: create_time DESC
$db->select('t_article@active@latest');
// SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE t_article.delete_flg = 0 ORDER BY t_article.create_time DESC

# yaml Database::whereInto 
$db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2]');
// SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE (t_article.delete_flg = 0) AND ((t_article.flag = 1) AND (t_article.flag2 < 2)) ORDER BY t_article.create_time DESC

# (pkval) 
$db->select('t_article(1)');
// SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE article_id = 1

# #offset-limit 
$db->select('t_article#40-60');
// SELECT * FROM t_article LIMIT 20 OFFSET 40

# AS alias 
$db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A');
// SELECT * FROM t_article AS A WHERE (A.delete_flg = 0) AND ((A.flag = 1) AND (A.flag2 < 2)) ORDER BY A.create_time DESC

# .
$db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A.article_id');
// SELECT A.article_id FROM t_article AS A WHERE (A.delete_flg = 0) AND ((A.flag = 1) AND (A.flag2 < 2)) ORDER BY A.create_time DESC

# ,
$db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A.article_id, title AS T');
// SELECT A.article_id, A.title AS T FROM t_article AS A WHERE (A.delete_flg = 0) AND ((A.flag = 1) AND (A.flag2 < 2)) ORDER BY A.create_time DESC

join

# :fkeyname  JOIN t_article  t_comment  fkeyAC: article_id 
$db->select('t_article<t_comment:fkeyAC');
$db->select('t_article<t_comment'); // 
// SELECT t_article.*, t_comment.* FROM t_article LEFT JOIN t_comment ON (t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id)

# [condition]  JOIN yaml  where 
$db->select('t_article<t_comment[delete_flg=0]');
// SELECT t_article.*, t_comment.* FROM t_article LEFT JOIN t_comment ON (t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id) AND (delete_flg=0)

#  base 
$db->select('t_article@active[article_id=9] AS A.article_id+t_comment:fkeyAC AS C.comment');
// SELECT A.article_id, C.comment FROM t_article AS A INNER JOIN t_comment AS C ON (C.article_id = T.article_id) WHERE article_id=9

subselect

# 
$db->selectArray('t_article/t_comment');
// SELECT t_article.*, t_article.article_id FROM t_article
// SELECT t_comment.comment_id AS comment_id, t_comment.* FROM t_comment WHERE t_comment.article_id IN ('1', '2', ...)

#  base 
$db->selectArray('t_article@latest[delete_flg=0] AS A.article_id/t_comment AS C.comment');
// SELECT A.article_id FROM t_article AS A WHERE delete_flg=0
// SELECT C.comment_id AS __dbml_auto_pk, C.comment, C.article_id AS __dbml_auto_ck FROM t_comment AS C WHERE C.article_id IN ('1', '2', ...)





# base 
$db->select([
    't_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A' => [
        'article_id',
        'T' => 'title',
    ],
]);
// : $db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A.article_id, title AS T');

# join 
$db->select([
    't_article@active[article_id=9] AS A' => [
        'article_id',
        // JOIN  JOIN 
        '+t_comment:fkeyAC AS C' => [
            //  ON 
            // ['on1' => 1, 'on2' => 2],
            'comment',
        ],
    ],
]);
// : $db->select('t_article@active[article_id=9] AS A.article_id+t_comment:fkeyAC AS C.comment');

# subselect 
$db->selectArray([
    't_article@latest[delete_flg=0] AS A' => [
        'article_id',
        // JOIN  subselect 
        't_comment AS C' => [
            'comment',
        ],
    ],
]);
// : $db->selectArray('t_article@latest[delete_flg=0] AS A.article_id/t_comment AS C.comment');

:fkeyname [condition] 2 $where
JOIN php
$db->select Gateway 

# base 
$db->select([
    't_article@active@latest A' => [
        'article_id',
        'T' => 'title',
    ]
], [
    'flag2'     => 1,
    'flag2 < ?' => 2,
]);
# base  Gateway 
$db->t_article->as('A')->scope('active latest')->column([
    'article_id',
    'T' => 'title',
])->where([
    'flag2'     => 1,
    'flag2 < ?' => 2,
])->select();
// 2: $db->select('t_article@active@latest[flag1: 1, "flag2 < ?": 2] AS A.article_id, title AS T');

# join 
$db->select([
    't_article@active A' => [
        'article_id',
        '+t_comment C' => [
            'comment',
        ],
    ]
], [
    'article_id' => 9,
]);
# join  Gateway 
$db->t_article->as('A')->scope('active')->column([
    'article_id',
    '+t_comment' => $db->t_comment->as('C')->foreign('fkeyAC')->column('comment'),
])->where([
    'article_id' => 9,
])->select();
// 2: $db->select('t_article@active[article_id=9] AS A.article_id+t_comment:fkeyAC AS C.comment');

# subselect 
$db->selectArray([
    't_article@latest A' => [
        'article_id',
        't_comment C' => [
            'comment',
        ],
    ]
], [
    'delete_flg' => 0,
]);
# subselect  Gateway 
$db->t_article->as('A')->scope('latest')->column([
    'article_id',
    't_comment' => $db->t_comment->as('C')->column('comment'),
])->where([
    'delete_flg' => 0,
])->array();
// 2: $db->selectArray('t_article@latest[delete_flg=0] AS A.article_id/t_comment AS C.comment');

php
ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::column() ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\TableDescriptor 

$db = new Database($connection, [
    //  <=> 
    'tableMapper'    => function ($tablename) {
        $entityname = ucfirst(preg_replace('#^t_#', '', $tablename));
        return [
            // 
            $entityname => [
                'entityClass'  => 'vendor\\Entity\\' . $entityname,
                'gatewayClass' => 'vendor\\Gateway\\' . $entityname,
            ],
            //  => 1
        ];
    },
    // 
    'tableMapper'    => function ($tablename) {
        return ucfirst(preg_replace('#^t_#', '', $tablename));
    },
]);

DB
"t_article" php "Article" 

$db->selectArray('Article.*');
$db->selectArray('t_article.*');

$db->insert('Article', $dataarray);
$db->insert('t_article', $dataarray);

SELECT t_article Article Article t_article
t_article Article Article t_article
SQL "t_article" "Article"


=>

DB

t_article select Article cast()
t_ancestor.***
$qb->cast(null) ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::cast()
$db->Article Article TableGateway

t_article Article

  • $db->t_article
  • $db->Article

Gateway
array, tuple

  • $db->t_article->tuple('*', ['id' => 1]);
  • $db->Article->tuple('*', ['id' => 1]);

1 1
tableMapper

TableA TableB

TableA TableB



tableA           tableB           tableC
                                   PK(auto)
                  PK(auto) <-----  FK
 PK(auto) <-----  FK


tableA           tableB           tableC
 PK1      <-----  PK1 & FK <-----  PK1 & FK
                  PK2      <-----  PK2 & FK
                                   PK3


tableA tableC tableB
tableB tableA tableC

tableA tableC 

// 
$db->tableA()->tableC()->array();

// tableA  tableC  JOIN 
// SELECT tableA.*,tableC.* FROM tableA INNER JOIN tableC ON tableA.PK1 = tableC.PK1


join, subselect, subexists

autoCastType DB Doctrine\DBAL\Types\Type 

// 
$db->setAutoCastType([
    // DATETIME 
    Type::DATETIME => [
        'select' => true,
        'affect' => false,
    ],
    // SARRAY 
    Type::SIMPLE_ARRAY => true,
]);
$row = $db->selectTuple('t_article', ['id' => 1]);
// t_article  public_time: DATETIME 
var_dump($row['public_time']);
// results:  DateTime 
class DateTime#2 (3) {
  public $date =>
  string(26) "2017-12-07 21:42:56.000000"
  public $timezone_type =>
  int(3)
  public $timezone =>
  string(10) "Asia/Tokyo"
}

// t_article  public_option: SARRAY( TEXT) 
var_dump($row['public_option']);
// results: 
array(3) {
  [0] =>
  string(2) "10"
  [1] =>
  string(2) "30"
  [2] =>
  string(2) "50"
}
//  SARRAY 
$db->insert('t_article', [
    'article_id'    => 1,
    'public_option' => ['10', '30', '50'],
]);
//  insert Array to string conversion

namespace ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway

class ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway::TableGateway

Database $table
Database QueryBuilder 

//  Database 
$gw = $db->table_name;   // 
$gw = $db->table_name(); // 

// 
$gw->array('*');
// id
$gw->lists('id');

// (1, 2)1
$gw->find(1, 2);

//  bool 
$gw->exists();
$gw->('*', ['status' => 'deleted']);
// id 
$gw->min('id');

// 
$gw->array([
    'childassoc' => $db->child(),
]);

//  JOIN 
$gw->array([
    // INNER JOIN
    '+children1' => $db->child(),
    // LEFT JOIN
    '<children2' => $db->child(),
]);

// 
$gw->array([
    'subcount' => $db->child->subcount(),
    'submin'   => $db->child->submin('child_id'),
    'submax'   => $db->child->submax('child_id'),
    'subsum'   => $db->child->subsum('child_id'),
    'subavg'   => $db->child->subavg('child_id'),
]);

// 
$gw->insert(['data array']);
// 
$gw->update(['data array'], ['where array']);
// 
$gw->delete(['where array']);

// 
$gw[1]['hoge_count'] += 1;                         //  SELECT + UPDATE 
$gw[1]['hoge_count'] = $db->raw('hoge_count + 1'); //

SELECT WHERE

addScope scope
addScope 1 Closure
Closure
Closure $this Gateway bind $this->alias
$this column where orderBy return
scopeXXX

scoping
column where orderBy 

// select  `NOW()` 
$gw->addScope('', 'NOW()');
// select  `WHERE delete_flg=0` 
$gw->addScope('active', [], ['delete_flg' => 0]);
// select  `ORDER BY create_date DESC LIMIT 10` 
$gw->addScope('latest', function ($limit = 10) {
    return [
        'orderBy' => 'create_date DESC',
        'limit'   => $limit,
    ];
});
//  this 
$gw->addScope('latest', function ($limit = 10) {
    return $this->orderBy('create_date DESC')->limit($limit);
});
// $this 
public function scopeLatest($limit = 10)
{
    $this->orderBy('create_date DESC')->limit($limit);
}

// 'active' 
$gw->scope('active')->array();
//  SELECT NOW(), t_table.* FROM t_table WHERE t_table.delete_flg = 0
// NOW() 

//  active, latest 
$gw->noscope()->scope('active')->scope('latest')->array();
//  SELECT t_table.* FROM t_table WHERE t_table.delete_flg = 0 ORDER BY t_table.create_date DESC LIMIT 10
// 
$gw->noscope()->scope('active latest')->array();

// Closure 
$gw->scope('latest', 9)->array();
//  SELECT NOW(), t_table.* FROM t_table ORDER BY t_table.create_date DESC LIMIT 9

// 
$gw->scoping('id', ['invalid_flg' => 1], 'id DESC')->array();
//  SELECT id FROM t_table WHERE t_table.invalid_flg = 1 ORDER BY id DESC
// 
$gw->column('id')->where(['invalid_flg' => 1])->array();
//  SELECT id FROM t_table WHERE t_table.invalid_flg = 1

//  insert/update/delete 
$gw->scope('active')->update(['column' => 'data']);
//  UPDATE t_table SET column = 'data' WHERE t_table.delete_flg = 0

insert/update/delete where
insert/update/delete
insert/update/delete

insert/update/delete
delete_flg = 0 $gw->update(['delete_flg' => 1], ['primary_id' => 99])
delete_flg = 0
insert/update/delete noscope unscope
ignoreAffectScope

select
1

// 
$gw->scope('active');
$gw->array();
//  `SELECT * FROM table_name` 

// 
$gw = $gw->scope('active');
$gw->array();
//  `SELECT * FROM table_name WHERE table_name.delete_flg = 0` 

// 
$gw->scope('active')->array();

(virtual|get|set)VirtualNameColumn ryunosuke\dbml\Database::overrideColumns()
get, set
virtual get set
implicit type 

// full_name 
public function getFullNameColumn()
{
    return 'CONCAT(first_name, " ", family_name)';
}
// full_name 
public function setFullNameColumn($value, $row)
{
    return array_combine(['first_name', 'family_name'], explode(':', $value, 2));
}
// full_name 2
public function virtualFullNameColumn($value=null, $row=null)
{
    if (func_num_args()) {
        return array_combine(['first_name', 'family_name'], explode(':', $value, 2));
    }
    else {
        return 'CONCAT(first_name, " ", family_name)';
    }
}

Traversable, Countable

Traversable Countable foreach count() 

// active  foreach 
foreach ($gw->scope('active') as $item) {
    var_dump($item);
}

// active 
$gw->count();

foreach array $defaultIteration
$defaultIteration

  • Database defaultIteration
  • $defaultIteration
  • $defaultIteration

count() count($gw) $gw->count('*') ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::count()

JOIN

or or JOIN
end 

# 
$db->t_article->join('inner', $db->t_comment, [$oncond])->array();

#  JOIN 
// end() 
$db->t_article->t_comment->end()->array();
// end()  SELECT * FROM t_comment t_article  t_comment  JOIN  t_comment t_comment  t_comment  array() 
$db->t_article->t_comment->array();
// JOIN 
$db->t_article->t_comment->as('C')->scope('active')->orderBy('id')->end()->array();

#  JOIN 
//  end() 
$db->t_article->t_comment()->array();
//  t_user  t_article  JOIN 
$db->t_article->t_comment()->t_user()->array();
//  scoping 
$db->t_article->t_comment('id, comment', ['id' => 3])->array();

# invoke 
$db->t_article->t_comment['@active AS C']()->array();

JOIN

JOIN $defaultJoinMethod
$defaultJoinMethod INNER, LEFT
"AUTO" AUTO JOIN INNER or LEFT
LEFT
AUTO NOT NULL NULL

clause
columnJOIN
whereON
orderBy ORDER
limit, groupBy, having JOIN where -> ON

where ON
ORDER RDBMS JOIN

limit, having JOIN

JOIN
AS A

$db->t_table['@scope AS T']('column', 'where')

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetGet()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::__toString () : string 

// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE t_table.primary_id = '1'
echo $gw->pk(1);
// SELECT T.id, T.title FROM t_table T WHERE T.create_at = '2014-03-31' LIMIT 1
echo $gw->as('T')->column(['id', 'title'])->where(['create_at' => '2014-03-31'])->limit(1);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetExists ($offset) : bool

$offset
$offset 

# 
$exists1 = isset($gw[1]);      // 1 true
$exists2 = isset($gw[[1, 2]]); // [1, 2] true

# 
$exists1 = isset($gw['article_title']);    // true
$exists2 = isset($gw['undefined_column']); // false

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetGet ($offset) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGatewayarrayryunosuke\dbml\Entity\Entityablemixed

$offset where pk
$offset '' tuple
$offset value
$offset
[condition] [] 

#  pk (where) 
$row = $gw[1]->tuple();      // 1
$row = $gw[[1, 2]]->tuple(); // [1, 2]
$row = $gw->find($pk);       // 2

# 
$row = $gw['*'];
// WHERE 
$row = $gw->[1]['*'];  // =1 SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE id = 1
$row = $gw->[1]['**']; //  QueryBuilder::column() 

# 
$title = $gw['article_title'];
// WHERE 
$title = $gw->pk(1)['article_title'];
$title = $gw->scope('scopename')['article_title'];

# 
$gw = $gw['@scope1@scope2 AS GW'];
$gw = $gw->scope('scope1')->scope('scope2')->as('GW'); // 

# 
$gw['G.id']->array();
// SELECT G.id FROM t_table G

# [condition]  [] 
$gw = $gw['[id: 123]']; // 
$gw = $gw['id: 123'];   // [] [] 
$gw = $gw['id=123'];    // 
$gw = $gw->where(['id' => 123]); // 

# invoke 
$db->t_article->t_comment['@scope1@scope2 AS C']($column, $where);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetSet ($offset, $value) : intarray

$offset null ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::insert()
$offset ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::modify()
$offset ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::update() 

# 1 insert
$gw[] = [$dataarray]; // $dataarray  insert 

# 1 modify
$gw[1] = [$dataarray];      // $gw->modify([$dataarray] + [pcol => 1])
$gw[[1, 2]] = [$dataarray]; // $gw->modify([$dataarray] + [pcol1 => 1, pcol2 => 2])

# 
$gw['article_title'] = '';
// WHERE 
$gw->scope('scopename')['article_title'] = '';
$gw['id: 1']['article_title'] = '';
$gw->pk(1)['article_title'] = '';
$gw[1]['article_title'] = '';

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::offsetUnset ($offset) : intarray

$offset ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::delete() 

# 
unset($gw[1]);      // 1
unset($gw[[1, 2]]); // [1, 2]

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::clone ($force = false) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway



$force true

Table

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::normalize ($row) : T

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::as ($alias) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway 

// SELECT * FROM tablename AS hoge_alias
echo $gw->as('hoge_alias');

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::end ($back = 0) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway

join

jQuery end() 

#  $select  t_child __get 
$select = $db->t_parent->t_child->select();

#  $select  t_parent end()  join 
$select = $db->t_parent->t_child->end()->select();

#  $select  t_child 1
$select = $db->t_parent->t_child->t_grand->end(1)->select();

setter, getter

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::modifier () : string 

// t_tablename
echo $gw->modifier();
// T
echo $gw->as('T')->modifier();

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::join ($type, $gateway, $on = [], $fkeyname = null) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway

JOIN 


# joinOn  innerJoinOn 
$db->t_from->joinOn($db->t_join, ['hoge = fuga']);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from INNER JOIN t_join ON hoge = fuga

# leftJoinOn  LEFT 
$db->t_from->leftJoinOn($db->t_join, ['hoge = fuga']);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from LEFT JOIN t_join ON hoge = fuga

# joinForeign  autoJoinForeign  INNER  AUTO 
$db->t_from->joinForeign($db->t_join);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from INNER JOIN t_join ON t_from.foreign_col = t_join.foreign_col

# leftJoinForeign  LEFT 
$db->t_from->leftJoinForeign($db->t_join);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from LEFT JOIN t_join ON t_from.foreign_col = t_join.foreign_col

# joinForeignOn  autoJoinForeignOn  INNER  AUTO 
$db->t_from->joinForeignOn($db->t_join, ['hoge = fuga']);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from INNER JOIN t_join ON (t_from.foreign_col = t_join.foreign_col) AND (hoge = fuga)

# leftJoinForeignOn  LEFT 
$db->t_from->leftJoinForeignOn($db->t_join, ['hoge = fuga']);
// SELECT t_from.* FROM t_from LEFT JOIN t_join ON (t_from.foreign_col = t_join.foreign_col) AND (hoge = fuga)

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::dryrun () : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::addScope ($name = "", $tableDescriptor = [], $where = [], $orderBy = [], $limit = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway 

$gw = $db->t_article->as('A');
$gw->addScope('scopename', []);
// $db->t_article  $gw as  $gw 
$gw2 = $db->t_article->scope('scopename');

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::mixScope ($name, $sourceScopes, ...$newscopes) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway 



#  a, b, c 

// 
$gw->mixScope('mixedABC', 'a b c');

// 
$gw->mixScope('mixedABC', [
    'a' => [1 ,2 ,3], //  a 
    'b' => [4, 5, 6], //  a 
    'c' => [7, 8 ,9], //  a 
]);

// 
$gw->scope('mixedABC')->array();
// 
$gw->scope('a b c')->array();

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::bindScope ($name, $binding) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway

bind

$args
[1 => 'hoge', 3 => 'fuga'] bind 13


bind 

// 3
$gw->addScope('abc', function ($a, $b, $c) {});

// 3
$gw->bindScope('abc', [2 => 'c']);
// 3 'c' 
$gw->scope('abc', 'a', 'b');

// 
$gw->bindScope('abc', [1 => 'b']);
// 2 'b', 3 'c' 
$gw->scope('abc', 'a');

// 2 'y', 3 'z' 
$gw->scope('abc', 'a', 'y', 'z');

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::scoping ($tableDescriptor = [], $where = [], $orderBy = [], $limit = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::column(), ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::where() 

// 
$gw->addScope('hoge', 'column', 'where', 'order', 99, 'group', 'having')->scope('hoge')->array();
$gw->scoping('column', 'where', 'order', 99, 'group', 'having')->array();

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::scope ($name = "", $variadic_parameters = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway


2

# scope1  scope 2 
$gw->scope('scope1 scope2');

# 
$gw->scope('scopename', 5);

# 
$gw->scope([
    'scope1' => 1,          // [1]
    'scope2' => ['a', 'b'], // 'a' 1'b' 2
    'scope3',               // 
]);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::getScopes () : array

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::getScopeParts ($name = "", $variadic_parameters = []) : array


$variadic_parameters scope 

# 
$gw->addScope('scope1', 'NOW()', 'cond');
$gw->getScopeParts('scope1');
// result: 
[
    'column'  => 'NOW()',
    'where'   => 'cond',
    'orderBy' => [],
    'limit'   => [],
    'groupBy' => [],
    'having'  => [],
];

# 
$gw->addScope('scope2', function ($id) {
    return [
        'column' => 'NOW()',
        'where'  => ['col' => $id],
    ];
});
$gw->getScopeParts('scope2', 123);
// result:
[
    'column'  => 'NOW()',
    'where'   => ['col' => 123],
    'orderBy' => [],
    'limit'   => [],
    'groupBy' => [],
    'having'  => [],
];

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::getScopeParams ($tableDescriptor = [], $where = [], $orderBy = [], $limit = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : array


method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::getScopeParamsForAffect ($tableDescriptor = [], $where = [], $orderBy = [], $limit = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : array

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::getScopeParams()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::pk (...$variadic) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway

where

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::where()


where 

# 1
$gw->pk(1);               // 
$gw->where(['pid' => 1]); // where 
// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE (pid = 1)

# 2
$gw->pk(1, 2);                 // 
$gw->where(['pid' => [1, 2]]); // where 
// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE (pid = 1 OR pid = 2)

# 1
$gw->pk([1, 1]);                           // 
$gw->where(['mainid' => 1, 'subid' => 1]); // where 
// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE (mainid = 1 AND subid = 1)

# 2
$gw->pk([1, 1], [2, 2]); // 
$gw->where([             // where 
    [
        ['mainid' => 1, 'subid' => 1],
        ['mainid' => 2, 'subid' => 2],
    ]
]);
// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE (mainid = 1 AND subid = 1) OR (mainid = 2 AND subid = 2)

# 2
$gw->pk([1], [2, 2]); // 
$gw->where([       // where 
    [
        ['mainid' => 1],
        ['mainid' => 2, 'subid' => 2],
    ]
]);
// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE (mainid = 1) OR (mainid = 2 AND subid = 2)

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::uk (...$variadic) : ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway

where

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::where()

pk
pk

1
2

# 
$gw->uk([1, 2]); // 
$gw->where(['unique_id1' => 1, 'unique_id2' => 2]); // where 
// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE (unique_id1 = 1) AND (unique_id2 = 2)

# 
$gw->uk('mail@address'); //  'mail@address' 
// SELECT * FROM t_user WHERE mailaddress = 'mail@address'

# 
$gw->uk('mail1@address', 'mail2@address');
// SELECT * FROM t_user WHERE mailaddress = 'mail1@address' OR mailaddress = 'mail2@address'

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::selectFind ($variadic_primary, $tableDescriptor = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

id1, id2, id3

  • find([10, 20, 30])
  • find(10, 20, 30)

  • 2 id1 = 10, id2 = 20, id3 = 30

  • find([10, 20, 30], ['column1', 'column2'])

  • find([10, 20, 30], 'column1', 'column2')
  • find(10, 20, 30, ['column1', 'column2'])
  • id1 = 10, id2 = 20, id3 = 30 SELECT column1, column2

2
(10, 20, 30) 

# 1
$row = $gw->find(1);
// SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE primary_id = 1

# 1
$row = $gw->find([1, 2], ['column1', 'column2']);
// SELECT column1, column2 FROM t_table WHERE (primary_id1 = 1) AND (primary_id2 = 2)

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::find ($variadic_primary, $tableDescriptor = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::findOrThrow ($variadic_primary, $tableDescriptor = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::find()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::findInShare ($variadic_primary, $tableDescriptor = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::find()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::selectExists ($tableDescriptor, $where = [], $for_update = false) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

EXISTS 

// EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_table)
$db->selectExists('t_table');

// NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE delete_flg = 0)
$db->selectNotExists('t_table', ['delete_flg' => 0]);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::subexists ($tableDescriptor = [], $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

EXISTS 

// SELECT 
$db->select([
    't_article' => [
        //  t_article  t_comment  true 
        'has_comment'     => $db->subexists('t_comment'),
        //  t_article  t_comment delete_flg = 0  true 
        'has_not_comment' => $db->notSubexists('t_comment', ['delete_flg' => 0]),
    ],
]);
// SELECT
//   EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_comment WHERE t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id) AS has_comment,
//   NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_comment WHERE (delete_flg = '0') AND (t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id)) AS has_not_comment
// FROM t_article

// WHERE 
$db->select('t_article', [
    //  WHERE EXISTS 
    $db->subexists('t_comment'),
]);
// SELECT
//   t_article.*
// FROM t_article
// WHERE (EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_comment WHERE t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id))

// JOIN t_article  t_comment 
$db->select('t_article, t_something', [
    // 
    't_article'          => $db->subexists('t_comment'),
    //  t_something  t_comment 
    't_something'        => $db->subexists('t_comment'),
    //  t_something :
    't_something:fkname' => $db->subexists('t_comment'),
]);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::notSubexists ($tableDescriptor = [], $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::subexists()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::exists ($tableDescriptor, $where = [], $for_update = false) : bool 

#  t_article  bool 
$db->exists('t_article');
// SELECT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_article)

#  t_article  bool 
$db->exists('t_article', ['delete_flg' => 0]);
// SELECT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE t_article.delete_flg = 0)

#  t_article  bool 
$db->exists('t_article', ['delete_flg' => 0], true);
// SELECT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE t_article.delete_flg = 0 FOR UPDATE)

method ryunosuke\dbml\Gateway\TableGateway::count ($column = [], $where = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : int

2

  1. count($gw);
  2. $gw->count('*');

1 php count()
2 COUNT
WHERE

count

namespace ryunosuke\dbml\Logging

class ryunosuke\dbml\Logging::LoggerChain

PSR-3

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::log ($level, $message, $context = []) : void

Logs with an arbitrary level.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::setLogger ($logger) : void

Sets a logger instance on the object.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::addLogger ($logger, $name = null) : Psr\Log\LoggerInterface[]

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::resetLoggers ($loggers) : arrayPsr\Log\LoggerInterface[]

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::emergency ($message, $context = []) : void

System is unusable.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::alert ($message, $context = []) : void

Action must be taken immediately.

Example: Entire website down, database unavailable, etc. This should
trigger the SMS alerts and wake you up.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::critical ($message, $context = []) : void

Critical conditions.

Example: Application component unavailable, unexpected exception.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::error ($message, $context = []) : void

Runtime errors that do not require immediate action but should typically
be logged and monitored.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::warning ($message, $context = []) : void

Exceptional occurrences that are not errors.

Example: Use of deprecated APIs, poor use of an API, undesirable things
that are not necessarily wrong.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::notice ($message, $context = []) : void

Normal but significant events.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::info ($message, $context = []) : void

Interesting events.

Example: User logs in, SQL logs.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\LoggerChain::debug ($message, $context = []) : void

Detailed debug information.

class ryunosuke\dbml\Logging::Logger

SQL

Database logger 

# 
$db = new Database($connection, [
    'logger' => new Logger([
        'destination' => STDOUT
    ]),
]);
# /var/log/query.log 
$db = new Database($connection, [
    'logger' => new Logger([
        'destination' => '/var/log/query.log'
    ]),
]);
# 
$db = new Database($connection, [
    'logger' => new Logger([
        'destination' => function ($log) { echo $log; }
    ]),
]);

buffer

buffer
fastcgi_finish_request array
BLOB INSERT

false


int


true

fastcgi_finish_request
BLOB INSERT

array

int true 2
http batch

Quotes a string for use in a query.

The usage of this method is discouraged. Use prepared statements
or AbstractPlatform::quoteStringLiteral() instead.

class ryunosuke\dbml\Logging::Statement

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\Statement::__construct ($statement, $logger, $sql) : void

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\Statement::bindParam ($param, &$variable, $type = Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::STRING, $length = null) : bool

Binds a PHP variable to a corresponding named (not supported by mysqli driver, see comment below) or question
mark placeholder in the SQL statement that was use to prepare the statement. Unlike Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::bindValue(),
the variable is bound as a reference and will only be evaluated at the time
that PDOStatement->execute() is called.

As mentioned above, the named parameters are not natively supported by the mysqli driver, use executeQuery(),
fetchAll(), fetchArray(), fetchColumn(), fetchAssoc() methods to have the named parameter emulated by doctrine.

Most parameters are input parameters, that is, parameters that are
used in a read-only fashion to build up the query. Some drivers support the invocation
of stored procedures that return data as output parameters, and some also as input/output
parameters that both send in data and are updated to receive it.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\Statement::bindValue ($param, $value, $type = Doctrine\DBAL\ParameterType::STRING) : bool

Binds a value to a corresponding named (not supported by mysqli driver, see comment below) or positional
placeholder in the SQL statement that was used to prepare the statement.

As mentioned above, the named parameters are not natively supported by the mysqli driver, use executeQuery(),
fetchAll(), fetchArray(), fetchColumn(), fetchAssoc() methods to have the named parameter emulated by doctrine.

method ryunosuke\dbml\Logging\Statement::execute ($params = null) : Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Result

Executes a prepared statement

If the prepared statement included parameter markers, you must either:
call Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\Statement::bindParam() to bind PHP variables to the parameter markers:
bound variables pass their value as input and receive the output value,
if any, of their associated parameter markers or pass an array of input-only
parameter values.

namespace ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin

trait ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin::OptionTrait

get/set trait

use getDefaultOptions


stack/unstack context
stack/unstack context 

#  hoge:1 
$that->stack();
$that->setOption('hoge', 1);
$that->doSomething(); //  hoge:1 
$that->unstack(); // 

#  hoge:2 
$cx = $that->context();
$cx->setOption('hoge', 2);
$cx->doSomething(); //  hoge:2 
unset($cx); // 

#  hoge:3 
$that->context(['hoge' => 3])->doSomething(); //  hoge:3 
//  context  RAII

stack/context
context clone

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::getDefaultOptions () : array

static

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::OptionTrait__callGetSet ($name, $arguments, &$called) : mixed

__call

OptionTrait__callGetSet('getHoge') getOption('hoge')
OptionTrait__callGetSet('setHoge', $value) setOption('hoge', $value)

$called true

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::OptionTrait__callOption ($name, $arguments, &$called) : mixed

__call

OptionTrait__callOption('hoge') getOption('hoge')
OptionTrait__callOption('hoge', $value) setOption('hoge', $value)

$called true

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::OptionTrait__call ($name, $arguments) : mixed

__call

OptionTrait__callGetSet OptionTrait__callOption

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::OptionTrait__destruct () : void

__destruct

context unstack

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::__destruct () : void

trait
use OptionTrait__destruct

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::setDefault ($overridden = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::getOriginal () : ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait

ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::context() $this

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::context ($options = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait 


// somthing  hoge:1, fuga:2 
$that->context(['hoge' => 1])->setOption('fuga', 2)->somthing();
//  hoge, fuga 
$that->somthing();

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait::stack ($options = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\OptionTrait


unstack 

// somthing  hoge:1, fuga:2 
$that->stack(['hoge' => 1])->setOption('fuga', 2);
$that->somthing();
//  hoge:1, fuga:2 
$that->unstack();
//  hoge, fuga 
$that->somthing();

//  hoge:1 
$restore = $that->storeOptions(['hoge' => 1]);
//  hoge:1 
$that->something();
// $retore 
$retore();

1 get2 set 

// getter 
$that->option('opt-name');
// setter 
$that->option('opt->name', 'opt-value');

trait ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin::SelectAggregateTrait

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SelectAggregateTrait::selectExists ($tableDescriptor, $where = [], $for_update = false) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

EXISTS 

// EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_table)
$db->selectExists('t_table');

// NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_table WHERE delete_flg = 0)
$db->selectNotExists('t_table', ['delete_flg' => 0]);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SelectAggregateTrait::selectNotExists ($tableDescriptor, $where = [], $for_update = false) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SelectAggregateTrait::selectExists() NOT

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SelectAggregateTrait::selectCount ($column, $where = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

COUNT ryunosuke\dbml\Database::selectAggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SelectAggregateTrait::selectMin ($column, $where = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

MIN ryunosuke\dbml\Database::selectAggregate()

trait ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin::AggregateTrait

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AggregateTrait::exists ($tableDescriptor, $where = [], $for_update = false) : bool 

#  t_article  bool 
$db->exists('t_article');
// SELECT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_article)

#  t_article  bool 
$db->exists('t_article', ['delete_flg' => 0]);
// SELECT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE t_article.delete_flg = 0)

#  t_article  bool 
$db->exists('t_article', ['delete_flg' => 0], true);
// SELECT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_article WHERE t_article.delete_flg = 0 FOR UPDATE)

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AggregateTrait::count ($column, $where = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : intarray

COUNT ryunosuke\dbml\Database::aggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AggregateTrait::min ($column, $where = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : intarray

MIN ryunosuke\dbml\Database::aggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AggregateTrait::max ($column, $where = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : intarray

MAX ryunosuke\dbml\Database::aggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AggregateTrait::sum ($column, $where = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : intarray

SUM ryunosuke\dbml\Database::aggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AggregateTrait::avg ($column, $where = [], $groupBy = [], $having = []) : intarray

AVG ryunosuke\dbml\Database::aggregate()

trait ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin::SubAggregateTrait

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::subexists ($tableDescriptor = [], $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

EXISTS 

// SELECT 
$db->select([
    't_article' => [
        //  t_article  t_comment  true 
        'has_comment'     => $db->subexists('t_comment'),
        //  t_article  t_comment delete_flg = 0  true 
        'has_not_comment' => $db->notSubexists('t_comment', ['delete_flg' => 0]),
    ],
]);
// SELECT
//   EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_comment WHERE t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id) AS has_comment,
//   NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_comment WHERE (delete_flg = '0') AND (t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id)) AS has_not_comment
// FROM t_article

// WHERE 
$db->select('t_article', [
    //  WHERE EXISTS 
    $db->subexists('t_comment'),
]);
// SELECT
//   t_article.*
// FROM t_article
// WHERE (EXISTS (SELECT * FROM t_comment WHERE t_comment.article_id = t_article.article_id))

// JOIN t_article  t_comment 
$db->select('t_article, t_something', [
    // 
    't_article'          => $db->subexists('t_comment'),
    //  t_something  t_comment 
    't_something'        => $db->subexists('t_comment'),
    //  t_something :
    't_something:fkname' => $db->subexists('t_comment'),
]);

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::notSubexists ($tableDescriptor = [], $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::subexists()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::subcount ($column, $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

COUNT ryunosuke\dbml\Database::subaggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::submin ($column, $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

MIN ryunosuke\dbml\Database::subaggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::submax ($column, $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

MAX ryunosuke\dbml\Database::subaggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::subsum ($column, $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

SUM ryunosuke\dbml\Database::subaggregate()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\SubAggregateTrait::subavg ($column, $where = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

AVG ryunosuke\dbml\Database::subaggregate()

trait ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin::AffectIgnoreTrait

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AffectIgnoreTrait::insertSelectIgnore (...$args) : intstringryunosuke\dbml\Query\Statement

IGNORE ryunosuke\dbml\Database::insertSelect()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AffectIgnoreTrait::insertArrayIgnore (...$args) : intstringstring[]ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Statement

IGNORE ryunosuke\dbml\Database::insertArray()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AffectIgnoreTrait::updateArrayIgnore (...$args) : intstringstring[]ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Statement

IGNORE ryunosuke\dbml\Database::updateArray()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AffectIgnoreTrait::modifyArrayIgnore (...$args) : intstringstring[]ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Statement

IGNORE ryunosuke\dbml\Database::modifyArray()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\AffectIgnoreTrait::changeArrayIgnore (...$args) : array

IGNORE ryunosuke\dbml\Database::changeArray()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\IteratorTrait::setProvider ($caller) : ryunosuke\dbml\Mixin\IteratorTrait



$this use 

// 
$that->setProvider(function () {return (array) $this;});
// $that->method() 
$that->setProvider('method');
// $that->method(1, 2, 3) 
$that->setProvider(['method'] => [1, 2, 3]);

class ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::Expression

new Expression('NOW()') select "NOW()"

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\Expression::forge ($expr) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\Expressionmixed

Expression 

# 
$expr = Expression::forge('hoge'); // string: hoge

# "NULL"  expression 
$expr = Expression::forge("NULL"); // Expression: "NULL"

# ( Expression 
$expr = Expression::forge("NOW()"); // Expression: "NOW()"

#  Expression 
$expr = Expression::forge(123); // Expression: "123"
$expr = Expression::forge(1.2); // Expression: "1.2"

#  Expression 
$expr = Expression::forge(true); // Expression: "1"
$expr = Expression::forge(false); // Expression: "0"

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\Expression::__callStatic ($expr, $params) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\Expression

    • (?,...,?)

  • new Expression('NOW()');
  • Expression::NOW();

  • new Expression('ADD(?, ?)', array(1, 2));
  • Expression::{'ADD(?, ?)'}(1, 2);
  • Expression::ADD(1, 2);

class ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::Operator


ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\Operator::define()

ryunosuke\dbml\Database::whereInto()

operatorresult
LIKE, BETWEEN, =, <>, etc...BETWEEN RDBMS IN <=>
'hoge:[~)' => [1, 9]hoge >= 1 AND hoge < 9 [~] [] () [~] [~) (~] (~) 4
'hoge:[~)' => [1, null]hoge >= 1 null
'hoge:[~)' => [null, 9]hoge < 9
'hoge:[~)' => [null, null]- null
'hoge:LIKE%' => 'wo%rd'hoge LIKE 'wo\%rd%'LIKE"%"LIKE %LIKE %LIKE%
'hoge:LIKEIN%' => ['he%lo', 'wo%rd']hoge LIKE 'he\%lo%' OR hoge LIKE 'wo\%rd%'IN LIKE ANY('str1', 'str2')
'hoge:PHRASE' => 'hello*world|phrase'hoge REGEXP 'hello.*world' OR hoge REGEXP 'phrase'LIKEREGEXP:, :, :NOT, :AND, :OR, :OR
'hoge:NULLIN' => [1, 2, 3, NULL]hoge IN (1, 2, 3) OR hoge IS NULLNULL IN [1, 2, 3, null] IN(1, 2, 3) or NULL 
#  FISOR 
Operator::define('FISOR', function ($column, $params) {
    $conds = array_fill(0, count($params), "FIND_IN_SET(?, $column)");
    return [implode(' OR ', $conds) => $params];
});

#  whereInto 
$db->whereInto([
    'col:FISOR' => [1, 2],
]);
// WHERE FIND_IN_SET(1, col) OR FIND_IN_SET(2, col)

#  is, equal  whereInto 
$db->whereInto([
    'colA' => Operator::FISOR(1, 2),
    'colB' => Operator::in(1, 2),
    'colC' => Operator::between(1, 2),
]);
// WHERE FIND_IN_SET(1, colA) OR FIND_IN_SET(2, col) AND colB IN (1, 2) AND colB BETWEEN 1 AND 2

classconstant string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\Operator::RAW

classconstant string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\Operator::COLVAL

class ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::SelectOption

SELECT

select SELECT
SELECT OPT1 OPT2 column1, column2 

$db->select('tablename.columname')->addSelectOption(SelectOption::DISTINCT);
// SELECT DISTINCT columnname FROM tablename

class ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::TableDescriptor

dbml
new

ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::column()

'(joinsign)tablename(pkval)@scope:fkeyname[condition]<groupby>+order-by#offset-limit AS Alias.col1, col2 AS C2'
joinsignJOIN '*':CROSS, '+':INNER, '<':LEFT, '>':RIGHT, '~':AUTO, ',':FROM
tablename
(pkval)
@scope Gateway scope
:fkeynameJOIN
[condition] yaml where
{condition} yaml
<groupby>GROUP BY
+order-byORDER BY
#offset-limitLIMIT, OFFSET
AS Alias
.col1, col2 AS C2

joinsign

*+<>~, JOIN

tablename


(pkval)

"()" WHERE IN
"()"

  • e.g. tablename(1) WHERE pid IN (1)
  • e.g. tablename(1, 2) WHERE pid IN (1, 2)
  • e.g. tablename((1, 2), (3, 4)) WHERE (mainid = 1 AND subid = 2) OR (mainid = 3 AND subid = 4)

RDBMS RDBMS AND OR

@scope

@

@

  • e.g. tablename@scope1@scope2 scope1 scope2

@

  • e.g. tablename@
  • e.g. tablename@@scope scope

@scope(1, 2)

  • e.g. tablename@latest(5) 5

:fkeyname

:
1

  • e.g. tablename:fkname
  • e.g. tablename 1
  • e.g. tablename:

[condition]

yaml
WHERE
ON

  • e.g. tablename[id: 1, delete_flg = 0] id = 1 AND delete_flg = 0 where

{condition}

yaml

  • e.g. tablename{selfid: otherid} selfid = otherid

<group-key> GROUP BY
"+" "-" [+-]

  • e.g. tablename<id> GROUP BY id
  • e.g. tablename<year, month> GROUP BY year, month

+order-by

[+-]columnname ORDER BY
"+" "-" [+-]

  • e.g. tablename+id ORDER BY id ASC
  • e.g. tablename-create_date+id ORDER BY create_date DESC, id ASC

offset-limit

#M-N M
LIMIT OFFSET "#40-50" LIMIT 10 OFFSET 40
4050-1M OFFSET N - M LIMIT
-N LIMIT 1 OFFSET M1
M 0 OFFSET
JOIN LIMIT

  • e.g. tablename#150-200 LIMIT 50 OFFSET 150
  • e.g. tablename#100 LIMIT 1 OFFSET 100 1
  • e.g. tablename#-100 LIMIT 100 M OFFSET

AS Alias


AS tablename T

.col1, col2 AS C2



AS aliasname AS

  • e.g. tablename.colA colA
  • e.g. tablename.colA, colB CB colA, colB CB

+order-by #offset-limit

  • tablename-create_date#0 1

(pkval), @scope, :fkeyname, [condition], +order-by, #offset-limit
:fkeyname, [condition]

  • tablename@scope:fkeyname[condition]
  • tablename@scope[condition]:fkeyname
  • tablename:fkeyname@scope[condition]
  • tablename:fkeyname[condition]@scope
  • tablename[condition]@scope:fkeyname
  • tablename[condition]:fkeyname@scope

@scope() (pkval)
@scope(1, 2) (pkval)
(pkval)

yaml "#" "@"


(pkval)

classconstant string[] ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\TableDescriptor::META_CHARACTORS

property mixed ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::descriptor

property string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::joinsign

property string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::table

property string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::alias

property ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression\TableDescriptor[] ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::jointable

property array ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::scope

property array ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::condition

property string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Expression::fkeyname

namespace ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Pagination

class ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Pagination::Paginator

paginate

Sequencer

    • 1100111000
    • 9999
    • 10011100 /3000
    • mysql SQL_CALC_FOUND_ROWS + FOUND_ROWS()
    • 223

$paginator = new Paginator($db->select('table_name', 'other where'));
// 2
$paginator->paginate(2, '1' [, '']);
// 
var_dump($paginator->getItems());
// IteratorAggregate  foreach 
foreach ($paginator as $item) {
    var_dump($item);
}

class ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Pagination::Sequencer

sequence

Paginator

    • id
  • /

N UI 

$sequencer = new Sequencer($db->select('table_name', 'other where'));
// id  150  50 
$sequencer->sequence(['id' => 150], 50 [, '']);
// 
var_dump($sequencer->getItems());
// IteratorAggregate  foreach 
foreach ($sequencer as $item) {
    var_dump($item);
}

  • 2

AUTO INCREMENT

class ryunosuke\dbml\Query::QueryBuilder

SELECT AFFECT

IteratorAggregate, Countable

IteratorAggregate, Countable foreach count($qb)
foreach array() count() 

$qb = $db->select('t_article');
foreach ($qb as $row) {
    // $row  ['id' => 1, 'title' => 'hoge title'] 
}
echo count($qb); // t_article

prepare ryunosuke\dbml\Query\Statement
prepare :name

classconstant array ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::CLAUSES

classconstant string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::LAZY_MODE_EAGER

classconstant string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::LAZY_MODE_BATCH

classconstant string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::LAZY_MODE_FETCH

classconstant string ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::LAZY_MODE_YIELD

classconstant array ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::LAZY_MODES

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::getDefaultOptions () : array

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::__construct ($database) : void

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::cast ($classname = null) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder


4

  1. callable
  3. null
  4. "array" 
# 1. callable
$qb->column('table_name')->cast(function ($row) {
    // $row 
    return new \ArrayObject($row, \ArrayObject::ARRAY_AS_PROPS);
});
// table_name  ArrayObject 

# 2. 
$qb->column('table_name')->cast(EntityClass::class);
// table_name  EntityClass 

# 3. null
$qb->column('table_name')->cast();
// table_name  TableName  ->  Database 

# 4. "array"
$qb->column('table_name')->cast("array");
//  13

lists pairs
value

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::operatize ($operator, $operands = []) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder 

# 10
$db->select('t_article A', [
    $db->subcount('t_comment C')->operatize('>=', 10),
]);
// SELECT A.* FROM t_article A WHERE (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM t_comment C WHERE C.article_id = A.article_id) >= 10

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::build ($queryParts, $append = false) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

  • see ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::column()
  • see ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::where()
  • see ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::orderBy()
  • see ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::limit()
  • see ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::groupBy()
  • see ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::having()

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::scope ($tablename, $scope, ...$args) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

method ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder::setLazyMode ($lazyMode = null) : ryunosuke\dbml\Query\QueryBuilder

lazyMode

fetch

  • eager: IN
  • batch: IN Generator
  • fetch: prepared statement
  • yield: prepared statement Generator
